name: Frameworkdelphi
tagline: Complete structure for developers quickly and easily using the programming model by layering Model View Presenter (MVP) with superclasses already be ready all the actions, persistence, validation, database, instance classes and layouts.
body:
Delphi Developer Sênior

Brazilian, single, 20 years

ABSTRACT
» Specialist Delphi, Object Oriented Programming, Encapsulation, Polymorphism, MVP, MVC and SQL. I 
have extensive domain in Android, Java, JavaScript, SEO, CSS, HTML. Solid experience in the 
development, preparation and implementation of projects. Qualities: Dedication, commitment, 
excellence in quality and productivity.
WHY HIRE ME?
» I am motivated by the intellectual and professional growth. In every company I worked always been 
one of the developers with the best productivity rates. In the last three companies was among the best 
programmers code excellent quality and always dedicating myself to the fullest. I use the methodology 
of automation, recycling and good programming practices. I have ideas for innovative software 
solutions, problems and improving development processes.

September 2012 – February 2013, Cachoeirinha - RS

 Framework Delphi
» Creating a framework in which using the Delphi programming model by layering Model view

and 100% by automating the process of developing new features.
» Technologies: Delphi 7 and Firebird 2.5.
June 2012 - July 2012, Lajeado - RS
 Gestor Total
» I developed a new user interface for focusing on usability and accessibility thus greatly improving

to favorites menus allowing users to identify themselves with the system. I 
also worked in the maintenance and creation of routines electronic invoice, 
inventory, customer base, reports, financial user control. I also created a 
report fully customized using the DevExpress cxDBGrid that enables the user 
to filter the data, make groups and also choose which columns are displayed.
» Technologies: Delphi 7, Firebird (1.5 and 2.5), DevExpress 2010, Acbr NFe, Git, IBX, Indy and JediJVCL.
August 2011 - July 2012, Lajeado - RS
 GPAF
» Developed a specific framework for the project, because all screens needed to fit the rules of law. 
I helped the developer mode work without network (stand-alone), when there is no connection data 
is recorded and searched only the local base and when the server connection is 
made back to data integration. They also collaborated on the development 
front cash, inventory, menu fiscal, exports, sales in two stages (pre-sale), Dav, 
Electronic Invoice, static clients, interface, usability.
» Technologies: Delphi 7, Firebird 1.5, DevExpress, JediJVCL, AcbrECF, IBX e Indy.
August 2011 - December 2011 Lajeado – RS
 System Update
» I created the upgrade system is fully autonomous and intelligent. He performs the check for 
updates every X hours if have update is done automatically downloads all of the files.
» By checking update and made a post on the site with the customer data if the client is allowed to 
update the site returns an XML mapping of all available files, the updater works intelligently by 
checking which files are outdated or missing after verification is done downloading these files. When 
the download finishes is also checked if the file is corrupted so that the files that persists arrive 
intact.» Before you start installing the update and automatically backed up and if any errors occur during 
the installation and made the restoration of data and one of the great 
advantages that the system reverts to the only step that the error 
occurred. The site also has a mechanism that manages the downloads 
so not overloading the servers. The user has the possibility to backup 
and restore data manually.
» The Business developer has a real-time monitoring of customers who are upgrading and update 
history. The developer also has the option of releasing beta versions, or official test quickly and 
easily, making it possible to release a version for only specific clients or to all clients.
» Technologies: Delphi 7, Firebird 2.5, XML, PHP, Mysql, MD5, Zip, DevExpress and JediJVCL.
May 2012 - July 2012, Lajeado – RS
 Licensing
» I created the licensing system users with the function of being imburlável. Not allowing use of the 
system if there were outstanding debts. Licensing works with an XML file that has the data and their 
customer specific releases. The data is encrypted in an XML file and also by the MD5 security is 
recorded so that it is impossible to edit the file without being detected by the system. The licensing 
works seamlessly with system calls (responsible for customer management) and with the site so 
that when any data updates the clients receive at least two hours the updated license file.
» Technologies: Delphi, Firebird 2.5, XML, Git, MD5, PHP, Mysql, IBX and Indy.
May 2011 - June 2012, Lajeado – RS
 Attendance

» Technologies: Delphi 7 and Firebird 1.5.
September 2011 - July 2012, Lajeado – RS

I developed a routine of sending e-mail automatically to customers who are in the system near the 
Date of renovation or monthly in arrears.
» Technology: Delphi 5, Firebird 1.5 and XML.
March 2012 - July 2012 Lajeado – RS
 Data Dictionary

 Tracker

form the customer, the service is also responsible for tracking change requests data licensing

depending on the type of request. Also responsible for tracking and logging of updates from clients.
» Technology: Delphi 7, Firebird 1.5 and Windows Service.
June 2012 - July 2012, Lajeado – RS Posted database
» I created the system of sending base with the goal of allowing the help desk can capture the 
customer's environment and use the base to reproduce errors or make the correction of the errors 
of the base. This functionality also proved very useful for testing new versions in mass thus 
eliminating errors before they happen on the client. The sender performs the compression system of 
generating the base and check if the FBK is intact and then creates a Zip with FBK and sends the 
FTP Business developer. 
» Technologies: Delphi 7, Firebird 1.5 and 2.5.
June 2012 Lajeado – RS
 Guardian
» I developed the application that aims guardian initialize other applications when they are not 
responding or have not been initialized. This application is hidden from the user and initializes it 
with the operating system. Using communication ports for TCP performs checks whether other 
applications are active, It initializes when the applications are disabled.
» Technology: Delphi 7, XML and TCP ports.
July 2012 Lajeado – RS

9:00 am or 14:00 hours is sent an e-mail to the employee and the manager making the alert.

January 2013 - February 2013, São Paulo - SP

### Welcome to GitHub Pages.
This automatic page generator is the easiest way to create beautiful pages for all of your projects. Author your page content here using GitHub Flavored Markdown, select a template crafted by a designer, and publish. After your page is generated, you can check out the new branch:

```
$ cd your_repo_root/repo_name
$ git fetch origin
$ git checkout gh-pages
```

If you're using the GitHub for Mac, simply sync your repository and you'll see the new branch.

### Designer Templates
We've crafted some handsome templates for you to use. Go ahead and continue to layouts to browse through them. You can easily go back to edit your page before publishing. After publishing your page, you can revisit the page generator and switch to another theme. Your Page content will be preserved if it remained markdown format.

### Rather Drive Stick?
If you prefer to not use the automatic generator, push a branch named `gh-pages` to your repository to create a page manually. In addition to supporting regular HTML content, GitHub Pages support Jekyll, a simple, blog aware static site generator written by our own Tom Preston-Werner. Jekyll makes it easy to create site-wide headers and footers without having to copy them across every page. It also offers intelligent blog support and other advanced templating features.

### Authors and Contributors
You can @mention a GitHub username to generate a link to their profile. The resulting `<a>` element will link to the contributor's GitHub Profile. For example: In 2007, Chris Wanstrath (@defunkt), PJ Hyett (@pjhyett), and Tom Preston-Werner (@mojombo) founded GitHub.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? Check out the documentation at http://help.github.com/pages or contact support@github.com and we’ll help you sort it out.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
